data.name: Depot organization 1
data.description:
In this puzzle, there are seven depots to arrange. Each depot is that of a hexagon, and their six walls (sides) are marked with a special type of material. We have to arrange the seven depots with one in the center and the other six surrounding it (in the shape of a bigger hexagon). However, every wall that is shared by two depots must have a matching material (letter) on the same side. The depots may be turned, but the order of the sides must be rotated along with it. For example, the depots (as a hexagon) can be rotated to turn from this orientation to the left to the right: ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5595067/32763380-4cadec04-c93a-11e7-8d52-6884c9dea40a.png) They may not be flipped as a mirror image. For your reference, here is a visualization of a test case and its solution: **Puzzle:** W T J G N D X F W K C M M N X T R W B C V Q J G M T S D V K C F S G K B G T R M W C **Solution:** 4K 1X 2R 6C 5G 0J 3C ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5595067/32763805-ee635f64-c93c-11e7-9050-7996f726a882.png) (Problem based on: Hexagon Puzzle (Problem 24) from HP CodeWars 2017 NA)

Input

**Each of 7 strings: Six** capital letters seperated by spaces, marking the texture of the walls around depot X (**0**-indexed) in clockwise order.

Output

The unique solution of **seven** pairs of two characters, a **number** of that of depot index and a letter. Out of the six possible orientations for the solution, print only the one for which the **center hexagon is oriented with its alphabetically lowest character pointed to the right**. The hexagon sequence must be printed left-to-right, top-to-bottom. The first hexagon in the input is the top left, and the last is the bottom right. After each index, the program must print the letter of the wall to the right. Join the seven values with spaces.

See the example above the specifications for a visualization of this format.

Constraints

There will be a unique solution.
